item.title: EPA targets dozens of regulations. And, 'stranded' astronauts may return to Earth
item.description: The Environmental Protection Agency announced yesterday plans to reconsider more than two dozen rules. And, astronauts "stranded" on the International Space Station may be able to return to Earth.
item.content:encoded:
The Environmental Protection Agency announced yesterday plans to reconsider more than two dozen rules. And, astronauts "stranded" on the International Space Station may be able to return to Earth.

(Image credit: Ting Shen/AFP)

item.title: Judge dismisses Fox News from sexual assault lawsuit against former star
item.description: A federal judge has dismissed Fox News as a defendant in a lawsuit filed against former anchor Ed Henry. Former producer Jennifer Eckhart alleges he sexually harassed and raped her.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge has dismissed Fox News as a defendant in a lawsuit filed against former anchor Ed Henry. Former producer Jennifer Eckhart alleges he sexually harassed and raped her.

(Image credit: Yuki Iwamura/AP)

item.title: President Trump's attempts to shrink government target civil rights efforts
item.description: President Trump revoked a 1965 executive order that required federal contractors to take steps to comply with nondiscrimination laws. Some fear women and people of color will lose opportunities.

item.title: The push to get electric air taxis for the 2034 Olympics in Salt Lake City
item.description: A Vermont company with operations in Utah says it can have electric air taxis ready for service in time for the 2034 Olympics in Salt Lake City. Pending federal regulations will be a big factor.
